metadata.title: CVE-2020-11080 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
In nghttp2 before version 1.41.0, the overly large HTTP/2 SETTINGS framepayload causes denial of service. The proof of concept attack involves amalicious client constructing a SETTINGS frame with a length of 14,400bytes (2400 individual settings entries) over and over again. The attackcauses the CPU to spike at 100%. nghttp2 v1.41.0 fixes this vulnerability.There is a workaround to this vulnerability. Implementnghttp2_on_frame_recv_callback callback, and if received frame is SETTINGSframe and the number of settings entries are large (e.g., > 32), then dropthe connection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnghttp2-14 - 1.52.0-1
nghttp2 - 1.52.0-1
nghttp2-client - 1.52.0-1
nghttp2-proxy - 1.52.0-1
nghttp2-server - 1.52.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nghttp2 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.52.0-1').
